Sometimes I Think I Can Dream in 4K

â¤ï¸ Krishna Chaitanya October 4, 2022

Sometimes, I feel like my dreams are more real than reality. Every detail, every frameâ€”so clear. But no sound. Like watching a muted movie in perfect quality. Yesterday, I had one of those dreams. It felt like I was actually there.

And I just canâ€™t forget it. Even after the whole day.

At first, everything is blur. I canâ€™t see properly. But I look down. My legsâ€¦ they donâ€™t look right. The veins are popping out, like something is broken inside. My hands are shaking. I am crying.

But no pain.

I look up. So many eyes on me. My whole class. Staring. Whispering. I feel strange. Iâ€™m sitting on the teacherâ€™s Bench. Why am I here? Whatâ€™s happening?

And thenâ€¦ I see her.

Harshi.

Sheâ€™s in the third-last bench. Looking straight at me.

Everything else is still blurry, moving like an illusion. But Harshiâ€¦ she is clear. Too clear. Like she doesnâ€™t belong in the dream.

For a second, I forget everything. The broken legs, the class staring.

All I can think isâ€”does she feel sad for me? Or not?

And thenâ€¦ I wake up.

But the dream stays with me.

Because it wasnâ€™t just a dream. It was a memory.

4th class. Albin. That idiot. Climbing up a ladder, sliding down with one hand, laughing like a hero. I saw him, and I thought, I can do that too.

So I climbed.

I slid.

And thenâ€”twist. Crack. Fall.

Pain. So much pain.

I was on the ground, screaming. My leg was gone. I couldnâ€™t move. Tears. Panic. Everything spinning.

Albin and Abhi picked me up, dragging me to the classroom. One hand on each of their shoulders. I was half-hanging, half-walking.

My mom ran in. Worried. Talking. Trying to calm me down. My teacher made me sit next to her, telling me, â€œItâ€™s okay, itâ€™s okay.â€ But I couldnâ€™t stop crying.

And then. Harshi.

She was just sitting there. Not scared. Not shocked. Just watching.

And then she smiled.

Not a big smile. Just a small one. Like she was telling me, â€œCalm down. Itâ€™s fine.â€ Just with her eyes, her face, her tiny hand gesture.

And somehow, that moment stuck with me.

Even now, after all these yearsâ€¦

I donâ€™t know why. But I canâ€™t forget it.

Maybe becauseâ€¦ She is haunting me.

Like a ghost.

But sheâ€™s not dead.

Or maybeâ€¦ the Harshi I knew is.
